Custom Portfolio Website for Sanskriti Tiwari

Here's a comprehensive plan for your customized portfolio website to impress during your interview rounds:

Website Structure

  1. Homepage (Hero Section)

    • Clean, professional header with your name "Sanskriti Tiwari" in an elegant font

    • Brief tagline (e.g., "UX Designer & Developer" or your professional focus)

    • High-quality professional headshot

    • Call-to-action buttons ("View My Work", "Contact Me")

  2. About Section

    • Professional introduction (3-4 sentences)

    • Your unique value proposition

    • Key skills displayed as icons/progress bars

    • Optional: Fun facts or personal interests to show personality

  3. Projects/Portfolio Section

    • 3-6 best projects with:

      • Project title

      • Brief description

      • Your role and contributions

      • Technologies/tools used

      • Images/demos

      • Links to live projects or case studies

  4. Experience/Education

    • Timeline format for work history

    • Relevant coursework if early career

    • Certifications or special training

  5. Contact Section

    • Professional email

    • LinkedIn profile

    • GitHub/other relevant platforms

    • Optional contact form

Design Recommendations

Color Scheme:

  • Professional palette (navy blue + gold, deep purple + silver, or teal + white)

  • Ensure good contrast for readability

Typography:

  • Pair a clean sans-serif (like Poppins or Montserrat) with an elegant serif

  • Consistent heading hierarchy

Interactive Elements:

  • Smooth scroll navigation

  • Hover effects on project cards

  • Optional: Light/dark mode toggle

Technical Implementation Options

  1. Simple Approach:

    • HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript

    • Host on GitHub Pages (free)

  2. Framework Options:

    • React.js (create-react-app)

    • Vue.js

    • Next.js for better SEO

  3. CMS Options:

    • WordPress with custom theme

    • Webflow for no-code solution

Unique Touches for Interview Impact

  1. "Why Hire Me?" Section

    • Highlight problem-solving abilities

    • Showcase unique strengths

  2. Case Studies

    • Detailed walkthroughs of 1-2 key projects

  3. Testimonials

    • Quotes from professors, colleagues, or internship supervisors

  4. Blog Section (Optional)

    • Demonstrate thought leadership

    • Share insights about your field

Timeline for Development

  1. Planning (1-2 days)

    • Content gathering

    • Site map creation

    • Design mockups

  2. Development (3-7 days)

    • Build core pages

    • Implement responsive design

  3. Testing & Refinement (2-3 days)

    • Cross-browser testing

    • Mobile optimization

    • Performance checks

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>Sanskriti Tiwari | Portfolio</title>
    <style>
        :root {
            --primary: #4b6cc1;  /* Professional blue */
            --secondary: #f5f7fa;
            --accent: #ff6b6b;
        }
        
        body {
            font-family: 'Poppins', sans-serif;
            margin: 0;
            padding: 0;
        }
        
        .hero {
            background: linear-gradient(135deg, var(--primary) 0%, #6b8cff 100%);
            color: white;
            height: 100vh;
            display: flex;
            align-items: center;
            padding: 0 10%;
        }
        
        .hero-content {
            max-width: 600px;
        }
        
        .hero h1 {
            font-size: 3.5rem;
            margin-bottom: 0.5rem;
        }
        
        .hero h2 {
            font-size: 1.8rem;
            font-weight: 300;
            margin-bottom: 2rem;
        }
        
        .hero-buttons {
            display: flex;
            gap: 1rem;
        }
        
        .btn {
            padding: 12px 24px;
            border-radius: 30px;
            text-decoration: none;
            font-weight: 500;
            transition: all 0.3s ease;
        }
        
        .btn-primary {
            background: white;
            color: var(--primary);
        }
        
        .btn-secondary {
            border: 2px solid white;
            color: white;
        }
        
        .btn:hover {
            transform: translateY(-3px);
            box-shadow: 0 10px 20px rgba(0,0,0,0.1);
        }
    </style>
    <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Poppins:wght@300;400;500;600;700&display=swap" rel="stylesheet">
</head>
<body>
    <section class="hero">
        <div class="hero-content">
            <h1>Sanskriti Tiwari</h1>
            <h2>Creating impactful digital experiences through design and code</h2>
            <div class="hero-buttons">
                <a href="#work" class="btn btn-primary">View My Work</a>
                <a href="#contact" class="btn btn-secondary">Contact Me</a>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
</body>
</html>

        color: white;
    }

        display: grid;
        grid-template-columns: repeat(auto-fill, minmax(300px, 1fr));
        gap: 2rem;
    }
    
    .project-card {
        border-radius: 8px;
        overflow: hidden;
        box-shadow: 0 5px 15px rgba(0,0,0,0.1);
        transition: transform 0.3s ease;
    }
    
    .project-card:hover {
        transform: translateY(-10px);
    }
    
    .project-card img {
        width: 100%;
        height: 200px;
        object-fit: cover;
    }
    
    .project-info {
        padding: 1.5rem;
    }

        color: var(--primary);
        text-decoration: none;
        font-weight: 500;
        display: inline-block;
        margin-top: 1rem;
    }
</style>

<script>
    // Simple filtering functionality
    document.querySelectorAll('.filter-btn').forEach(button => {
        button.addEventListener('click', () => {
            // Update active button
            document.querySelectorAll('.filter-btn').forEach(btn => {
                btn.classList.remove('active');
            });
            button.classList.add('active');
            
            // Filter projects
            const filter = button.dataset.filter;
            document.querySelectorAll('.project-card').forEach(card => {
                if (filter === 'all' || card.dataset.category === filter) {
                    card.style.display = 'block';
                } else {
                    card.style.display = 'none';
                }
            });
        });
    });
</script>

4. Interview-Ready Features to Add

  1. Achievement Metrics

html
Copy
Download
Run
<div class="achievements">
    <div class="metric">
        <div class="number" data-count="15">0</div>
        <div class="label">Projects Completed</div>
    </div>
    <div class="metric">
        <div class="number" data-count="3">0</div>
        <div class="label">Industry Certifications</div>
    </div>
    <div class="metric">
        <div class="number" data-count="100">0</div>
        <div class="label">Hours of User Testing</div>
    </div>
</div>

<script>
    // Animate counting numbers
    function animateCounters() {
        const counters = document.querySelectorAll('.number');
        const speed = 200;
        
        counters.forEach(counter => {
            const target = +counter.getAttribute('data-count');
            const count = +counter.innerText;
            const increment = target / speed;
            
            if (count < target) {
                counter.innerText = Math.ceil(count + increment);
                setTimeout(animateCounters, 1);
            } else {
                counter.innerText = target;
            }
        });
    }
    
    // Trigger when section comes into view
    window.addEventListener('scroll', () => {
        const achievements = document.querySelector('.achievements');
        const position = achievements.getBoundingClientRect().top;
        const screenPosition = window.innerHeight / 1.3;
        
        if (position < screenPosition) {
            animateCounters();
        }
    });
</script>

    <script>
        // Project Filtering
        document.querySelectorAll('.filter-btn').forEach(button => {
            button.addEventListener('click', () => {
                // Update active button
                document.querySelectorAll('.filter-btn').forEach(btn => {
                    btn.classList.remove('active');
                });
                button.classList.add('active');
                
                // Filter projects
                const filter = button.dataset.filter;
                document.querySelectorAll('.project-card').forEach(card => {
                    if (filter === 'all' || card.dataset.category === filter) {
                        card.style.display = 'block';
                    } else {
                        card.style.display = 'none';
                    }
                });
            });
        });

        // Smooth scrolling for navigation
        document.querySelectorAll('a[href^="#"]').forEach(anchor => {
            anchor.addEventListener('click', function (e) {
                e.preventDefault();
                
                document.querySelector(this.getAttribute('href')).scrollIntoView({
                    behavior: 'smooth'
                });
            });
        });

        // Animate skill bars on scroll
        window.addEventListener('scroll', () => {
            const skills = document.querySelector('.skills');
            const position = skills.getBoundingClientRect().top;
            const screenPosition = window.innerHeight / 1.3;
            
            if (position < screenPosition) {
                document.querySelectorAll('.skill-level').forEach(bar => {
                    bar.style.width = bar.parentElement.previousElementSibling.textContent;
                });
            }
        });
    </script>
</body>
</html>

2. How to Use This Template

  1. Save the code:

    • Create a new folder for your portfolio

    • Save the code as index.html

  2. Add your content:

    • Replace placeholder text with your actual information

    • Add your real projects (update images and descriptions)

    • Include your contact details

  3. Add images:

    • Create an images folder in your project directory

    • Add your profile photo (name it profile-image.jpg)

    • Add project images (project1.jpg, project2.jpg, etc.)

  4. Create your resume:

    • Save your resume as PDF in the same folder

    • Name it sanskriti-tiwari-resume.pdf

3. Deploy Your Website

Option 1: GitHub Pages (Free)

  1. Create a GitHub account if you don't have one

  2. Create a new repository named username.github.io (replace username with yours)

  3. Upload all your files

  4. Go to Settings > Pages > Select main branch

  5. Your site will be live at https://username.github.io

Option 2: Netlify (Drag-and-drop)

  1. Go to app.netlify.com

  2. Drag your project folder into the deployment area

  3. Your site will be live instantly

4. Customization Tips

  1. Change colors:

    • Modify the CSS variables at the top:

    css

    Download
    :root {
    --primary: #4b6cc1;  /* Change this color */
    --secondary: #f5f7fa;
    --accent: #ff6b6b;
}

  2. Add more projects:

    • Duplicate the project card HTML block

    • Update the image, title, description and category

  3. Add animations:

    • Consider adding AOS library for scroll animations

        // Smooth scrolling for navigation
        document.querySelectorAll('a[href^="#"]').forEach(anchor => {
            anchor.addEventListener('click', function (e) {
                e.preventDefault();
                
                document.querySelector(this.getAttribute('href')).scrollIntoView({
                    behavior: 'smooth'
                });
            });
        });

        // Animate skill bars on scroll
        window.addEventListener('scroll', () => {
            const skills = document.querySelector('.skills');
            const position = skills.getBoundingClientRect().top;
            const screenPosition = window.innerHeight / 1.3;
            
            if (position < screenPosition) {
                document.querySelectorAll('.skill-level').forEach(bar => {
                    const width = bar.parentElement.previousElementSibling.lastElementChild.textContent;
                    bar.style.width = width;
                });
            }
        });
    </script>

    <script>
        // Smooth scrolling for navigation
        document.querySelectorAll('a[href^="#"]').forEach(anchor => {
            anchor.addEventListener('click', function (e) {
                e.preventDefault();
                
                document.querySelector(this.getAttribute('href')).scrollIntoView({
                    behavior: 'smooth'
                });
            });
        });

        // Animate skill bars on scroll
        window.addEventListener('scroll', () => {
            const skills = document.querySelector('.skills');
            const position = skills.getBoundingClientRect().top;
            const screenPosition = window.innerHeight / 1.3;
            
            if (position < screenPosition) {
                document.querySelectorAll('.skill-level').forEach(bar => {
                    const width = bar.parentElement.previousElementSibling.lastElementChild.textContent;
                    bar.style.width = width;
                });
            }
        });
    </script>

Here's the fastest step-by-step guide to get your portfolio live in under 5 minutes:

🚀 Ultra-Fast Method (3-5 minutes)

  1. Copy the entire code I provided above

  2. Save it:

    • Press CTRL + S (Windows) or CMD + S (Mac)

    • Name it portfolio.html

    • Save type: "All Files" (not .txt)

  3. Make it live (choose one):

    • A. Netlify (Easiest):

      1. Go to Netlify Drop

      2. Drag your portfolio.html file into the box

      3. Get instant live link (e.g., random-name.netlify.app)

    • B. GitHub Pages:

      1. Go to github.com/new

      2. Name repository [yourusername].github.io (e.g. sanskriti-tiwari.github.io)

      3. Upload portfolio.html

      4. Go to Settings > Pages > Select "main" branch > Save

  4. Share the link:

    • Netlify: your-site-name.netlify.app

    • GitHub: yourusername.github.io

🔄 If You Need to Update Certificates (3 extra minutes)

  1. Upload PDFs:

    • Go to Google Drive

    • Upload all certificate PDFs

    • Right-click each > "Share" > "Anyone with link"

  2. Replace links in the HTML:

    • Find all C:\Users\pc\... paths

    • Replace with Google Drive share links
